definition: Year of the Ox or Bull (e.g. 2009)
ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
see 猴年馬月|猴年马月[hou2 nian2 ma3 yue4]

sentences.english: Yet the past year, the Year of the Ox, turned out to be full of fluctuations and changes.
sentences.chinese: 刚过去的牛年，充满起落和变化。

sentences.english: It is clear that the fate of the global economy will continue to dominate the headlines in the Year of the Ox.
sentences.chinese: 牛年里，大家关注的依然会是世界经济的情况。

sentences.english: China's markets were mostly higher Friday, the last trading day in the Year of the Ox.
sentences.chinese: 今天是牛年最后一个交易日。

sentences.english: There is no better way to welcome in the Year of the Ox than a jump into the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 没有比跳进海中更好的办法来迎接牛年的到来。

sentences.english: Cow will come after mouse is done.
sentences.chinese: 鼠年过去牛年才会到来。

sentences.english: On December 31, Japan will bid farewell to the current Chinese Year of the Rat and welcome the Year of the Ox, or the Cow, as locals call it.
sentences.chinese: 12月31日，日本将告别鼠年，迎来牛年。

definition: colloquial term for 生肖[sheng1 xiao4] the animals associated with the years of a 12-year cycle
one of the twelve animals symbolic of the earthly branches 地支[di4 zhi1]/animal from the Chinese zodiac
birth year as designated by animal symbols (mouse, ox, tiger etc)
Year 2, year of the Bull or Ox (e.g. 2009)
